snippet: The agency opened a civil rights inquiry into the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager as protests went into their third day in a St. Louis suburb.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation opens civil rights inquiry into fatal shooting by police officer of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown as protests go into their third day in St Louis suburb of Ferguson; officers warily face off against protesting crowd of hundreds of mostly African-Americans, in response to looting and violence day earlier that resulted in 32 arrests.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and ERICA GOODE
byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Ferguson, and Erica Goode from New York. D. J. Wilson contributed reporting from St. Louis, Alan Blinder from Atlanta, and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York.

lead_paragraph: The agency opened a civil rights inquiry into the fatal shooting of an unarmed black teenager as protests went into their third day in a St. Louis suburb.

headline.main: F.B.I. Steps In Amid Unrest After Police Kill Missouri Youth
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Steps In Amid Unrest After Police Kill Missouri Youth
